_exec_summary.SummaryText:
A. Accidental Release Prevention and Emergency Response

Johnny Appleseed / Zirkle Fruit Company in Malott Washington, accidental release prevention policy involves a unified approach that integrates technologies, procedures, and management practices. It is the policy of this company to adhere to all federal and state safety and environmental regulations.

Personnel at Johny appleseed / ZFC do not respond to ammonia releases. The emergency action plan requires employees to call 9-1-1 and evacuate the plant in the event of an ammonia release. ZFC use defensive actions only in the event of an amminia release.

Anhydrous Ammonia is used on-site in a closed refrigeration system. Chemical properties of ammonia make it necessary to observe certain safety precautions in handling ammonia in order to:
*Prevent unnecessary human exposure
*Reduce the threat to our personnel
*Reduce the threat to the community

B. Facility and Regulated Substance Handled

Johnny Appleseed/ZFC is a controled atmospher cold storage facility, located at 226 B&O road, Malott Washington in Oakanogan county.

The regulated substance used at Johnny Appleseed / ZFC is Anhydrous Ammonia, CAS# 7664-41-7. It is used as a refrigerant. 

C. General Accidental Release Prevention Program

Johnny Appleseed/ZFC's accidental release prevention program is based on the following key elements:
*Training of personnel
*Preventative maintenance program
*Use of safety equipment
*Use of standard operating procedures

This facility complies with the following regulations and standards.
*OSHA and WISHA's process safety management rule
*Applicable Washington State and federal safety and environmental regulations
*SARA title 3 tier two reporting

The Ammonia refrigeration system was installed to applicable standards and local codes at the time of instalation. Pipeing and equipment is secured and protected. Compresor (engine room) doors are tight fitting and open outwards. Other safety systems utilized includes the following

:
*Computerized controls, which can be operated remotely
*Suction trap hi-level floats
*High discharge pressure shut down
*Low suction pressure shut down
*High discharge temerature shut down
*Oil pressure failureshut down
*High ampers shut down
*Automatic timer to prevent short cycling
*Oil filters plugged shut down
*250 psi relief valves on high pressure side, to prevent overpressure situations
*150 psi relief valves on low pressure side, to prevent overpressure situations

Standard operating procedures have been prepared to be used by employees performing operational fuctions. Procedures are kept in the engine room and refrigeration technision's office. These procedures include:
*Pre-start up procedures
*Routine operations
*Maintenance
Response to major and minor releases
*Emergency action plan

D. Five-Year Accident History

Johnny Appleseed/ZFC has had no accidents involving ammonia in the past five years.

E. Emergency action plan (Defensive actions)

In addition to the operating procedures, Johnny Appleseed/ZFC has established emergency action guidelines for releases involving ammonia. These procedures instruct personnel to evacuate and notify 9-1-1 so that the public and public safety agencies will be notified.

F. Planned Safety Improvements

Johnny Appleseed/ZFC will continue to provide traing for personnel responsible for the ammonia system.
